qas.question: Have quails ever been used for entertainment purposes ?

answers.text: They were originally kept as songbirds, and they are thought to have been regularly used in song contests.

qas.question: Where can quails typically be found in the wild?

answers.text: it is found in bushy places, in rough grassland, among agricultural crops, and in other places with dense cover.

qas.question: What is the typical diet consist of for qails ?

answers.text: seeds, insects, and other small invertebrates.

qas.question: From what country do most domesticated  quails today descend from ?

answers.text: modern domesticated flocks are mostly of Japanese quail (Coturnix japonica)

context: The quail is a small to medium-sized, cryptically coloured bird. In its natural environment, <a1_0>it is found <b5_0>in bushy places, in rough grassland, among agricultural crops, and in other places with dense cover<b5_0/>.<a1_0/> It feeds on <a2_0><b6_0>seeds, insects, and other small invertebrates<b6_0/>.<a2_0/> Being a largely ground-dwelling, gregarious bird, domestication of the quail was not difficult, although many of its wild instincts are retained in captivity. It was known to the Egyptians long before the arrival of chickens and was depicted in hieroglyphs from 2575 BC. It migrated across Egypt in vast flocks and the birds could sometimes be picked up off the ground by hand. These were the common quail (Coturnix coturnix), but <a3_0>modern domesticated flocks are mostly of Japanese quail (Coturnix japonica)<a3_0/> which was probably domesticated as early as the 11th century AD in <b7_0>Japan<b7_0/>. <a0_0><b4_0>They were originally kept as songbirds, and they are thought to have been regularly used in song contests<b4_0/>.
